snippet: Peter Cott and Kenneth Leedom, now in their late 80s, face cancer, Alzheimer’s, and concern about remaining able to take care of each other.
abstract: Peter Cott and Kenneth Leedom, gay couple in their late 80s who have been together for 58 years, are facing cancer, Alzheimer’s, and concern about remaining able to take care of each other; men, who married in 2011 within three months of New York's legalization of same-sex marriage, reside in senior building in Lower Manhattan and have lived through number of significant moments in New York's political and social history.
lead_paragraph: Peter Cott and Kenneth Leedom, now in their late 80s, face cancer, Alzheimer’s, and concern about remaining able to take care of each other.

headline.main: Two Men, 58 Years and Counting. A Love Story.
headline.print_headline: 58 Years and Counting. A Love Story.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
